txt.en: 'It was I who spoke to you, Durin, my friend.'
'Sorcery, aye, but not of the sort you fear.'
'This is the work of the First Crafter.'
'I would not speak falsely to you, Durin, my friend.'
'I know you for my friend Durin, for I have seen you in all your guises during my long sleep.'
Lifelike Statue
'Your outward form does not hide you from the sight of my dream.'
'I have seen much you have forgotten.'
'I will show these sights to you, that you may remember them.'
'See, then, what you have forgotten.'
'There is no help we can provide, my friend.'
'This was to be your end.'
Mótsog
'But you did, my friend.'
'Can you not see yourself behind the guise of each ruler I have shown to you?'
'Here it was that you offered Gundabad to the Zhélruka.'
'Durin the Fifth, slayer of the dragon Thorog!'
'Does it always end thus?'
Talk to Durin in the forgotten chamber
Remain on your guard
Talk to the strange dwarf
Witness the visions granted by the stranger
Mótsog has promised to show Durin forgotten sights.
Mótsog has promised to show Durin forgotten sights.
It cannot be denied that Mótsog possesses a curious power. How can he reveal these visions to you?
Mótsog has promised to show Durin forgotten sights.
Mótsog has promised to show Durin forgotten sights.
It cannot be denied that Mótsog possesses a curious power. How can he reveal these visions to you?
Mótsog has promised to show Durin forgotten sights.
Durin's Bane

'It has always been difficult for me to see these trials, unable to intervene.\n\n'It is no reward, friend of Durin, to remain helpless in this. But it could not be otherwise. The dreaming sight cares not.'
Mótsog has promised to show Durin forgotten sights.
It cannot be denied that Mótsog possesses a curious power. How can he reveal these visions to you?
A strange sorcery envelopes the forgotten chamber deep below Gundabad. What secrets lie within?
Mótsog has promised to show Durin forgotten sights.
Mótsog has promised to show Durin forgotten sights.
'Many were the glorious deeds you accomplished in that war, my friend.'
Witness the visions granted by Mótsog
'But this was the last: retreating into Khazad-dûm, and sealing the doors.'
Witness the visions granted by Mótsog
Talk to Mótsog
Witness the visions granted by Mótsog
'Something is not right, [placeholder]. Some servant of Mótsog the Traitor may lie in wait, seeking to harm us.\n\n'Remain on your guard.'
Witness the visions granted by Mótsog
'You are a friend of Durin? Then you too will see what I have to show him.'

'They called it Durin's Bane, but I knew it by another name, in another age. Long before the creature came to hide in this forgotten cavern I knew it as Askâdurs, and the memory of its scorching passage through my city in the heights is cruel.\n\n'But that was long ago.'

'Aye. That is the fate of Durin in every age in which he appears.'

Mótsog's expression is devoid of emotion and impossible to read.

'I have seen them all.'
It cannot be denied that Mótsog possesses a curious power. How can he reveal these visions to you?
'Aye, my king. The outer door is sealed.'

'It has been both curse and blessing to see these trials, for it was the will of the First Crafter that I should be unable to look away.\n\n'I have seen moments of triumph, but so too have I seen defeats that would scar the iron heart of any dwarf, marking him forever with its imprint.'
Witness the visions granted by the stranger
Talk to Mótsog
Witness the visions granted by Mótsog
Witness the visions granted by Mótsog
Talk to Mótsog
Witness the visions granted by Mótsog
'How can this be?'
Witness the visions granted by Mótsog
'That is... Durin the Sixth! We have to help him!'
Talk to Mótsog
'Every dwarf knows the tale. But this vision is so lifelike...'
'The statue of the Traitor is so life-like. Is this a tomb?'
'I can almost hear him.'
'But how can I know the sound of the Traitor's words?'
'The bearer of that voice died long ago!'
'So you were, and yet...'
'And yet I am put in mind of the Anvil of Winterstith, and of a voice that spoke through the ice.'
'...the dragon was also your end.'
'It spoke of dwarves long-dead, and of great deeds.'
'It was the voice of a dwarf, not a dragon.'
'It was the voice of a friend, courteous but stern.'
'Fell sorcery!'
Longbeard Warrior
'When Sauron waged his war upon Eregion, Durin the Third fought well and bravely!'
'Did he not?'
'But the dwarves survived. The king did what needed to be done.'
'I have seen all your victories and all your defeats.'
Instance: The Dreaming Dwarf
'Durin the Fourth came to the aid of the Last Alliance, in distant Mordor.'
'How is it you beheld this?'
'The First Crafter gave to me the dreaming sight.'
Durin stands in the forgotten chamber deep beneath Gundabad, boiling with rage.
Durin has asked you to remain alert for any sign of danger.
The dwarf claiming to be Mótsog says he can show Durin what he has forgotten.
The dwarf claiming to be Mótsog has promised to show Durin forgotten sights.
The dwarf claiming to be Mótsog has promised to show Durin forgotten sights.
DNT - Blah!
'Explain yourself, villain!'
'Lies!'
'And yet you bear the visage of Mótsog the Traitor!'
'How do you know my name?'
'You say you know me.'
'So too do I know you: Mótsog the Traitor, leader of the Greymauls, father of treachery.'
'Why should I trust your words?'
'What do you think, [placeholder]?'
'Durin the Second ruled in Gundabad.'
'Would that I could have seen it at its height!'
'Stop! Stop these visions!'
'Put an end to this nonsense!'
'Is it done?'
